titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Collection of Type Specimens
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Arts Library Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 00:01

did.abstract: The collection comprises ephemeral type specimens in a variety of formats, including pamphlets, single sheets, and broadsides.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Collection of Type Specimens, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection comprises ephemeral type specimens: pamphlets, single sheets, and broadsides. Series I contains materials that document a single font or font family. Series II contains materials that document more than one font; they are listed by the manufacturer or distributor. Series III is a clipping file with information on typographers. Series IV contains broadsides, divided into four subseries: Typeface; Manufacturer; Typographer; and Calligraphy and Lettering.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Typeface. II. Manufacturer. III. Typographer. IV. Broadsides. V. Miscellaneous.
Entries are arranged alphabetically within each category.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Typeface specimens in this series are ordered alphabetically by the name of the font or font family. The typeface manufacturer or designer, or both, are listed following the font name. A date indicates the date of publication for the typeface specimen.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is ordered alphabetically by the name of manufacturer. Individual items contained in each file are listed below the manufacturer's name.
Please note that the series begins with an "Anonymous" file and ends with an "Unidentified" file.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically, usually by the typographer's surname.

did.unittitle: Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is divided into four subseries: Typeface; Manufacturer; Typographer; and Calligraphy and Lettering. Items within each subseries are arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: The Engraver's Guide; The Sign Painter's Manual; The School Masters Assistant; and the Young Student's Desideratum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous materials related to typography, including Graphic Arts subject files with both primary and secondary resources.
